history.content: Prereqs are usually strictly enforced for Stat 140. You could consider taking Data 100 first if you feel Data 8 or Star 20 isn’t necessary, since Data 100 counts as an upper division class for CS as well. Highly recommend 140 over 134 even if you don’t have the prereqs yet

Prereqs are usually strictly enforced for Stat 140. You could consider taking Data 100 first if you feel Data 8 or Star 20 isn’t necessary, since Data 100 counts as an upper division class for CS as well. Highly recommend 140 over 134 even if don’t have the prereqs yet

children.subject: I'm pretty sure prereqs are strictly enforced. I was in the same position as you and decided to take 134, and it honestly just isn't a very good class. I'm sure both 140 and 126 do a much better job of teaching probability.

history.content:
I'd like to take STAT 140 next semester and I fulfill all of the below requirements except Stat 20 (I haven't taken Data 8 but I have done 61A). Would the stats department allow me to enrol in the class? I am currently an EECS major with plans to double in Stats. 

Prob 140 is restricted to undergraduates who:

  • Have not taken Stat 134; only one of Stat 134 and Prob 140 can be taken for credit
  • Have taken a year of calculus at the level of Math 1A-1B and preferably higher; Prob 140 involves some double integration and partial derivatives
  • Have taken or are concurrently taking linear algebra in Math 54 or EE 16A or Stat 89A or Math 110, or have taken an equivalent linear algebra course at another college
  • Have taken Data 8 or Data 100 or both Stat 20 and CS 61A
history.subject: STAT 140 Prereqs
